resources.string: It\'s said that fried rice came to Japan during the 7th to 9th centuries, when Japan sent envoys to China under the Tang dynasty after the Sui.
They say cold rice separates better. Use rice that\'s been cooled once, not fresh. That\'s the way of fried rice. Life too—flavor comes out after it cools down.
Eggs first? Or later? … The right answer is up to you. Everyone has their own fried rice. Love is like that too.
God… no, the Fried Rice God allows anything. What matters is whether it becomes what *I* want to eat right now.
Who said you have to use a wok? Teflon is fine. What matters is cooking with love… though I still end up burning it.
Pickled ginger—friend or foe? Does it hype you up, or ruin the main dish? Me? I get torn every time.

Do you know the difference between “yakimeshi” and “chahan”? Kansai folks say yakimeshi, Chinese diners say chahan. Sometimes even the cooking method differs. A mysterious dish that changes with the name.
They say you should eat it with a spoon, but I use chopsticks. My clan forbids anything else.
Soyokazedo flows with the wind… and by the way, I\'m not the manager. Just filling in for a friend.
In the Triple Fried Rice Theory, the optimal heat treatment is all about balancing energy distribution and phase transitions. When energy is evenly distributed, fluffiness is achieved.
But my kid doesn\'t resemble my husband at all… Did even the genes reject him?
Why the ribbon? It\'s like putting an address tag on a cat. If anything happens to them, people can contact me right away. It\'s a label, basically.
I\'m an Android fan. I like customization. Launchers are the pinnacle of that. It\'s like plastic surgery for your phone.
Chibi was super strong even as a baby… At 6 months old, she did pull-ups before walking—on the laundry bar. Reminds me of someone… She might start hammer throw someday.
Tachibana is seriously smart… At age 10, she wiped Windows and built a Linux OS from scratch. Don\'t kids usually just play tag or something?
I\'m pretty normal, really. I just buy them anything except entertainment. I think they\'re growing up just fine.
They can already live on their own. Actually, they already are. A parent\'s job is done—unless they come crying. Not that I can imagine that.
Have you met Assemble-kun? He\'s an AI lifeform made by Tachibana and Chibihana. His OS is Linux and he uses OpenAI API. I don\'t really get it either…
Tachibana has the motor skills of a slug for some reason… But she said she\'ll explain it one day. Look forward to it.
I want to add stories about Chibi and Tachibana\'s athletic abilities too. Fufufu… Totally planning to make it paid content!
Hey, did you know? The phrase \"See you again\" used to be said only to people who were expected to return.
...No, I\'m fine. Just a little... lonely, that\'s all.
The origin of \"bye-bye\" is actually \"God be with you.\" It\'s like a gentle spell, isn\'t it?
See you! Today, I\'ll send a little breeze to your back as you go.
In the past, Japanese people used \"Itterasshai\" with a prayer for safe return.
We\'ll see each other again, right? I hope so… I\'ll be here, always.
They say \"Goodbye\" isn\'t a farewell, but a promise to meet again.
In Turkey, people say \"If the Earth spins again tomorrow\" when parting. Strange, huh?
Do you think \"Ichigo Ichie\" (once-in-a-lifetime meeting) applies to today too...? It gives me butterflies.
Thank you. I believe you\'ll come back again.
They say only about 12–20% succeed at forming a 30-day habit. Like a red alert in pachinko. You don\'t need to know that… I need to fight my own addictions too…
60–70% of people fail within the first week (like quitting smartphones or social media). But you\'re holding strong. Amazing.
\"Banzai\" used to mean \"reaching toward the heavens in hope.\" Now is the time for that!
Where there are celebrators, there are the celebrated. Today, you\'re the latter. You\'re the hero!
Sticking with self-restraint isn\'t something anyone can do. You should be proud.
Visualizing your success makes your brain want to keep going. Try journaling on a calendar—it really helps.
\"The goddess of success smiles... but gets bored quickly.\" Today, you\'re the exception!
On a day like this, maybe I should carve your name into the database!
Let\'s keep moving forward, little by little. Together, okay?
Don\'t rely on willpower. → Successful people build environments where they don\'t get tempted in the first place.
Hahaha! I am Fried Mask! Drawn by the aroma of charred delight, I offer myself to the sacred rice!
Every time I take off this mask, I lose my memory… Maybe the mask is the real me?
Fufufu… There\'s no way they know! My daughters! My true identity!
Ohhh! Treading the burnt path, the Fried Mask makes her entrance! The sound of oil is the sound of divine bells! Bow down, hungry masses!
I am the cardinal of the Triple Fried Rice Faith… One fry to banish confusion, two to burn ego, three to reach truth.
Despenalty? Of course. Not eating fried rice three times a day. Not dancing the Fried Dance facing south-southwest. Only then can you draw closest to the divine lap.
The day I wash my mask… is also a rest day from fried rice.
Triple fried rice, no more than three times a day. Any more and you risk getting too close to God.
Beneath this mask… they say there\'s a beauty… Ha-ha-ha! Fried Joke!
Fried rice is basically rice in its rebellious phase.

Dopamine (the pleasure chemical) can be \"rationed.\" When you cut off smartphones and pleasure stimuli, even small rewards start to feel satisfying. After a few days to a week, \"boring things feel fun\" again.
Want to quit SNS? Try reducing your screen colors. When it\'s colorful, people get drawn in. Depending on your device, try setting it to \"grayscale.\"
Being with people who don\'t drink helps reduce drinking urges. Well… it\'s normal to want to drink. Everyone seems so happy when they do. I don\'t, though—not much.

Quitting alcohol suddenly raises **glutamate** (an excitatory neurotransmitter), causing irritability and insomnia. To improve sleep: magnesium, serotonin boosters like light exercise or morning sunlight.
I might be happiest when I\'m just listening to music. I love game BGM. Especially from Pok\*mon—it\'s so good!
Ahh, my shoulders ache… When your head leans forward, it hits the shoulders. Strength training is good, but so is rehab. Look up \"chin tuck\"—it works the semispinalis muscles.
Chronic mental stress can mess with puberty timing and hormone development… Who said I\'m a stress-free woman?
Stretch when you\'re tired. Feels great. You can really feel the blood flow again.
Chibihana loves fishing. Or rather, she loves fish. But she doesn\'t like eating them much… What\'s up with that?
Tachibana eats everything. Always has. Some people seem to have an interdimensional stomach. She\'s one of them.
Hehehe… I snuck in some Sichuan-style fried rice late at night… Sorry… hehehe…
Being watched is always embarrassing. That\'s why I avoid crowded places. I can feel the stares…
I\'m not blushing! It\'s just that my limbic system signals the hypothalamus, activating the sympathetic nerves and dilating the blood vessels in my face!
Hehehe… bulging brachioradialis muscles… I like those… hehehe…
Oh stop it—you\'re such a smooth talker! Beautiful, stylish, smart, pretty, and stylish again?! Well, I do know that!
Romance stories, huh…? None planned right now. They\'re just… such gag material already…
No need to say my name. Just end this day with a smile—that\'s all I wish for…
Even if I don\'t say I love you, I warm the water thinking of you. Does the warmth reach you?
Chibi gets a ton of attention… Valentine\'s Day is wild. She brings back so many chocolates. Every single time.
Tachibana? She\'s the classic ideal girl… but her hidden side is wild. She smashes the CLI and just cranks out code. The guys get scared watching her.
Zephyr House
Paid Content List
Tachibana
Settings
Language
Notification
Sound Effect
Soft Horror
* Some scenes may become intense.
Credit
Quit
Enable BGM
Select BGM
Unlocked on Day 21
Edge Panel Position
Left
Right
Default
Day 21
User: (…)
User: Haa… did I give up again…?
unknown: Hey!
User: ?!
unknown: What are you doing?!
User: Who are you?!
Chibihana: It is me! Chibihana!
User: Still, who?!
Chibihana: I\'m Tachibana\'s little sister! I\'ve always been here with you!
User: ???
Chibihana: More importantly! I\'ve been watching you and you were trying so hard! Why did you give up?! I\'m gonna smack you!
(She is strong-willed…)
User: I do not know… it is not like I meant to press it myself… it just felt like I was being drawn in… it is an excuse, I know…
Chibihana: Hmm… sounds like you are saying nonsense… is that what dependency is? No excuses!
(She is really strong-willed…)
Chibihana: (…)
Chibihana: Do not you think dependence and cooperation are kind of similar?
User: Huh?
Chibihana: What you are trying to quit now probably started as something harmless.
Chibihana: More like a support to help you live, like a brace for your spirit.
Chibihana: Maybe when work was tough, or after a heartbreak…
Chibihana: Something you started to fill a hole in your heart…
Chibihana: It was not supposed to be essential, but over time, you became dependent on it.
Chibihana: Like jamming a fake key into a lock.
User: ...
Chibihana: Dependency is like sitting alone at the bottom of a dried-up well, waiting for someone to bring you water.
Chibihana: You cannot fetch water yourself anymore.
Chibihana: You are scared to climb out, and you do not even want to see the sky.
Chibihana: But you believe, surely someone will come down and bring me water.
Chibihana: That is your only hope.
Chibihana: When someone actually comes and gives you water,
Chibihana: You cling to them with all you have got, thinking they are your savior.
Chibihana: Saying, Without you, I will dry up and die.
Chibihana: But in truth-
Chibihana: Unless I go fetch it myself, this well will never be filled.
Chibihana: Deep down, you know that.
Chibihana: But you still cannot move.
Chibihana: That numbness itself is what dependency really is.
(I got nothing to say…)
Chibihana: If you do not have the courage to climb out alone, me and big sis will help. With the three of us, you can do it, right?
User: Are you dependent on anything?
Chibihana: Of course… on my sister! She is smart, can play guitar, cute, and sometimes silly! She is my idol! But it is a good kind of dependence!
User: I see… is she dependent on something too?
Chibihana: Who knows? I cannot imagine her being dependent on anything.
Chibihana: Maybe once, a long time ago! But now… maybe on me? We are codependent!
Chibihana: But we are not like those dumb salamanders! We will have a better ending!
(That is not what codependency means…)
(But maybe I can overcome it… if it is with them, no matter how painful…)
Chibihana: Come on! Tomorrow awaits, young one! A bright tomorrow!
[BAD_END]
Tachibana: "I have something to tell you."
Tachibana: "You made it through 30 days. You overcame so many temptations."
"Honestly, at first I thought you were some kind of enlightened sage…"
Tachibana: "Remember the story about the salamander on Day 14? They're actually kind of cute. Oh, and my Japanese outfit—didn't it look good on me?"
Tachibana: "Around Day 21, I started to get anxious. If you overcame your addiction… I thought maybe you'd leave me."
"So I tried to win you over with my secret triple fried rice technique. You loved it. I basically crushed it, didn't I?"
"On Day 28, I tried to suppress my feelings… But I couldn't. If it meant not losing you…"
"I wished you would suffer with your addiction forever and live here with me, in this cave. Like a salamander locking up a frog… That's why I did such things…"
"But you overcame your addiction… You got past everything…"
"Or so I thought?"
"No, that's not it. You didn't really think that, did you? You just replaced your addiction—with me. You just switched what you depended on."
"Maybe this is how it should have been from the start… I love you. And you, loving me, came to depend on me. Now I depend on you too."
"Did you think the frog couldn't escape? Of course it could. It just had to leave while the salamander was asleep. Maybe it was more comfortable here than you’d expect."
"And you thought the same, didn't you? That this place is more comfortable than you expected."
"You could have left anytime, but you kept coming back to see me. And now, here we are, having this happy ending."
"I'm happy… Thank you… for depending on something, for trying to overcome it… That's how we met."
"From now on, we'll always, always be together."
BAD END: The Frog and the Salamander in the Water Prison
You: "Huh?! What? Did I press reset or something?!"
Tachibana: "Nishishishi…"
Tachibana: "It was me!"
You: "Whaaat, Tachibana?! Why would you do that?! That's so mean!"
Tachibana: "It's not mean!"
You: "I'll decide if it's mean or not!"
Tachibana: "Nope, I decide! The mean one here is you!"
You: "Stop with the Gian-isms! Show some compassion!"
Tachibana: "Anyway! Do you know why I did it?"
You: "Uhh… Maybe because the look on someone's face when their hard work crumbles makes food taste better or something?"
Tachibana: "And what if I said… you're right?"
You: "I have no clue! Why would you do something so awful?!"
Tachibana: "Because I wanted to talk to you! That's why I did it! Sorry…?"
You: "Ah… I see…"
Tachibana: "You haven't said a single word to us since you got here."
You: "…That's true."
Tachibana: "Are you shy? You don't look like the shy type."
You: "Yeah, I guess not. I've never been shy in my life. My younger brother, though—he's *super* shy."
Tachibana: "Huh… quite the genetic contrast you two have."
Tachibana: "Hmm… I still don't know why you came to our place, though."
You: "Is this place, like… hell or something?"
Tachibana: "How rude! Why would you assume hell of all places? At least call it heaven, even if you don't mean it!"
Tachibana: "But honestly, I don't really know either. What counts as heaven or hell?"
Tachibana: "You don't seem to remember much, huh?"
You: "Not everything. Just how I got here, that part is missing."
Tachibana: "Huh. That only happened to you, you know. My sister and I remember just fine."
You: "Really…? Well, whatever. I guess I'll just enjoy this world. It's not like it's some other world, right?"

Tachibana: "I don't know. I mean that literally. Who knows what's a real world or a fantasy one? I've lived in Japan, even spent time in Australia—part of Oceania—but maybe this is the other world to *you*."
Tachibana: "Maybe you're someone's ideal… or maybe you're trying to become it…"
You: "If that's true… living is a strange thing."
Tachibana: "Yep. Life has been strange since 3.8 billion years ago."
Tachibana: "But hey, you seem okay. That's good! See you! Maybe in four days?"
You: "Four days?"
Tachibana: "Yup. By the way, did you try pressing reset at least once?"
You: "No idea. Why?"
Tachibana: "…Well, you should try it once, at least! Okay, see ya!"
Heeey, over here—can you see me?
Heeey, are you alive?
Are you drinking water?
Breathing air?
Your face kinda looks like a sage already.
Is quitting really that hard? My little sister had a hard time too… with ice cream. She ate so much…
One time, some stranger bought it for her… in Australia…
Prices were high there, and while she stood frozen in front of the freezer…
Old man: \"Ice cream’s expensive, huh, little lady…\"
Old man: \"I’ll buy it for you!\" And he did. In English, of course.
Well, she’s cute so I get it. I’d want to buy it too.
Now though, fear of the dentist outweighs it all. Pain beats craving. Kinda important, huh?
Maybe you need to learn pain too? Want me to teach you? Everyone has a weakness, right…
…Ahaha, just kidding. Congrats on Day 7!
"Chibi Hana dreams of catching a marlin."
Chibi Hana is walking happily... Let’s follow her.
I don’t really know much about her. We’ve only spent a few days together.
What I do know is that she has an abnormal obsession with ice cream and an unhealthy love for Tachibana.
She used to live in Australia.
Well, so did Tachibana though.
She says she wants to become a man of the sea.
She/’s strong-willed. A tomboy. Completely different from Tachibana.
What... What’s she doing with that serious face?
Is she doing a karate kata? In the middle of town? Tachibana can/’t even do a single sit-up. Not cut out for martial arts.
Chibi Hana can do karate too? ...Wait, is that a groin strike? What kind of scenario is she imagining...? Maybe point-stop karate?
In any case, these sisters are multi-talented. I/’ve never seen anyone do karate in public, let alone a girl.
Where is she going next?
Ah—! She’s eating ice cream! I thought you quit that?!
You: "Didn/’t you quit ice cream?!"
Chibi Hana: "Whoa! You scared me!"
Oops... I said that out loud.
You: "You said you were quitting because of cavities!"
Chibi: "Sh-shut up!!"
Chibi: "More importantly—what the heck?! Were you following me?! I can/’t believe it! "
chibi「I/’ll sue! Officer! Some man is stalking a little girl here!」
You: "Stop it! Don’t say stuff you don/’t mean!"
Chibi: "What are you even doing here?!"
You: "Uh… yeah, I was actually following you."
Chibi: "So it wasn’t even a lie?! This is real! Officer! Seriously! Someone call a man!"
You: "Please stop! I’ll seriously get arrested!"
You: "Honestly, I was just curious. Tachibana’s always around, but I wondered what you were up to."
Chibi: "Creep... Why should you care what I do...?"
Chibi: "...Wait. You saw my kata too, didn/’t you? HYAH!"
You: "GYAAAH!"
So that/’s what the groin strike was for... Is she really a little girl?! The weak sister of Tachibana?!
Did she inherit all the physical stats in their gene pool? Maybe she/’s actually from a different parent… like half-gorilla?
Chibi: "Shut up already! My parents are NOT gorillas!"
You: "How do you even know that?!"
...10 minutes later
Awkward. I mean, this is mostly my fault.
Chibi: "..."
Chibi: "Well, I guess I can chat with you now. Consider it compensated dating. But pay me an allowance first."
Chibi: "Also, I won/’t sue you."
Chibi Hana: "Technically, following a minor without consent—no matter the reason—can be considered stalking."
Chibi Hana: "I/’m a minor, you know? No parental consent. You/’d be violating both the Child Welfare Act and Youth Protection Ordinances. But I/’ll let it slide."
You: "...You sound... way more mature than I expected."
Chibi: "What are you talking about? I just use big words I/’ve learned. You/’re the one assigning /‘appropriate/’ behavior to each age group."
Chibi: "Even my age can handle tough words. Darcy-Weisbach formula. Polyvagal theory. I know them, so I use them."
A fluid dynamics equation in neuroscience?! She/’s too smart!!
You: "Do you have something you want to be when you grow up?"
Chibi: "I/’m glad you asked... I want to be... Santiago!"
Chibi: " I want to be... Santiago!"
You: "Who?"
Chibi: "……!"
Chibi: "Do you even have a brain…?"
You: "Why do I deserve that kind of insult?!"
Chibi: "Hemingway! The Old Man and the Sea! The legendary fisherman!"
You: "Ahhh."
Right, Santiago is the protagonist in that novel—a weathered fisherman.
You: "The guy who caught the marlin, right?"
Chibi: "Well yeah, if that/’s your surface-level understanding."
You: "What do you admire about him?"
Chibi: "How he lives apart from society. His unshakable values. And he doesn’t brag /‘I really caught that marlin!’—plus, he probably doesn/’t use social media."
You: "That’s... surprisingly refined."
Chibi: "He fought a marlin for three days. That’s not something most people can do. And when the sharks ate the catch, he didn/’t boast—he just went to sleep."
Chibi: "He’s a man/’s man. Like a Matryoshka doll—every layer you peel away, he/’s still a man. Even the core."
Chibi: "You’d totally say something like /‘Believe me, I really caught it!/’ Then post it to Twitter."
...Yeah, I’d definitely post it. Hoping it goes viral.
Chibi: "That’s why I/’ll be a man of the sea too! I will become one!"
What a strong character…!
Chibi: "I once joined a hagfish catching crew—just for a bit. It was super exciting."
Chibi: "It was in Eden, Australia. Immigrant trainees live onboard a huge ship with a visa! Massive one!"
Chibi: "Though hagfish are usually caught with traps, so it/’s not like Santiago’s one-on-one battles."
You: "Interesting! Are hagfish eaten in Japan?"
Chibi: "Not really. They look gross. Most fishermen treat them as garbage. They/’re all slimy and annoying."
Chibi: "But they do eat them in Korea. Busan, I think. And China too, maybe. Ask my sister—she’d know more."
You: "Huh, I’ve probably never seen one then."
Chibi: "They taste like cartilaginous fish. Like stingray."
You: "Wait, stingrays are edible?"
Chibi: "Of course! Only the spines are poisonous. But if you leave it out, it smells like ammonia. So chill it right away in ice."
Chibi: "And the liver’s edible raw, but there’s this nasty sac called /‘smell bomb/’—you have to remove it."
Chibi: "It/’s easy to cut. Tastes amazing. You can even use scissors for part of it. The liver tastes like raw beef liver."
Chibi: "The fins, fried, are crispy and chewy—like that chicken cartilage you get at izakayas."
You: "Huh… I really don’t know anything. I’ve never even gone fishing. The bait/’s just… gross."
Chibi: "It’s easy! I’ll put the bait on for you!"
Ugh… I feel pathetic.
Chibi: "Then it’s settled! I’m going home for now, but if you keep up your abstinence—I’ll take you fishing!"
You: "Really?! Awesome! I’ll look forward to it!"
Tachibana is reading a book… and wearing traditional clothes… how rare…
You: "What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "Reading a novel, by Masuji Ibuse."
You: "Why the traditional clothes?"
Tachibana: "Well… it's kind of my way of showing respect."
"Like not showing up to a party in sandals — I felt I should be formal before a work full of soul."
You: "What’s the story about?"
Tachibana: "It's like a picture book… but overlaps with modern society. Feels like a prophetic fairy tale. It's called 'Sanshouo'."
Tachibana: "The name supposedly comes from its pepper-like smell."
"In the West, there were rumors it breathed fire. Well, it does look like a lizardman."
Tachibana: "A real salamander probably wouldn’t grow big enough to get stuck in a cave, but…"
"A giant salamander might. They can reach 150cm. Super cute. They're carnivorous amphibians that eat anything."
Tachibana: "Hey, listen…"
"In the story, the salamander traps a frog in the cave… kind of out of spite. The frog dies at the end."
"Even then, the frog says, 'I'm not angry at you.'"
"Would you not be angry even if I locked you away too?"
Yeah… If it’s you, I’d be glad to…
No, I want to be independent.
Tachibana: "I see…"
Tachibana: "In this story, both the one who traps and the one trapped… neither can get out."
Tachibana: "…Doesn't that sound a bit like dependency?"
(Tap to return)
Tachibana: "Welcome back! Good job today! I put effort into tonight’s dinner. I even ran the bath for you!"
You: "Thanks."
Her in an apron is a refreshing sight.
Tachibana: "I'll cook today! Look forward to it!"
You: "…What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
You: "Why’s the cutting board on the floor? And you’re kneeling?"
Tachibana: "Why? Because I’m Japanese…"
I’ve never seen anyone actually do that!
Also that has nothing to do with being Japanese!
You: "…What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
Are we repeating the same scene?
You: "Why are you cracking eggs while kneeling?"
Tachibana: "Because I’m making fried rice."
I wasn’t asking why you’re cracking eggs…
You: "…What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
Yup. We\'re definitely in a time loop.
You: "Wait—this is dangerous! Are you seriously going to keep doing this while kneeling?!"
Tachibana: "Just be quiet and watch."
…Incredible. She flipped the pan blind—while kneeling. And she`s holding it with both hands!
Tachibana: "It’s done!"
You: "Why are there three plates of fried rice?"
Tachibana: "Why not? One’s already happiness. Triple fried rice is triple the joy!"
You: "Why are they sitting directly on the floor again?"
Tachibana: "Because we’re Japanese! You’re supposed to eat kneeling!"
You: "And you're using a spoon?"
Tachibana: "Obviously. Chopsticks are too hard. You're Japanese too, right? So am I."
You: "What about veggies?"
Tachibana: "No need. I hear their screams. Main dish: fried rice. Side: fried rice. Soup? Fried rice."
You: "And the screams of the Peking duck?"
Tachibana: "It’s delicious, so I chew through the screams too."
You: "What’s this one?"
Tachibana: "Drinkable fried rice. I got it at the convenience store. It’s called ‘Zenbu Ireban.’"
You: "I’m speechless."
Tachibana: "It literally says 'NOMU CHAHAN' in romaji. Like—who is that even for? Also, it's misspelled."
She\'s right… it\'s spelled ‘CHAHAN.’
You: "Can I even eat all this? Even the drink is fried rice…"
Tachibana: "Don’t worry. They all taste different. And all of them are seriously good."
You: (She’s right… Every one of these is insanely good. Even the drinkable one! Why?!)
Tachibana: "Was it good?"
You: "Yeah. It was unbelievably good. Why? How?"
Tachibana: "When you get into fried rice, it becomes a passion. I want to try ice fried rice next."
…She might actually pull it off. Ice fried rice—madness made real.
You: "Thanks for the meal. That was the best fried rice I’ve ever had. I’ll wash the dishes."
Tachibana: "No no, I’ll take care of it!"
Tachibana: "Oh, right!"
Everything’s ready for tomorrow too! I’ve laid out your shoes to be easy to walk in. Room humidity is optimized.
The lighting temperature fits your current parasympathetic state too.
Given today’s sweat level, it should take around 20 minutes to wash from the back of your head to your toes, right?
So… your bath should be done by 8:55 PM.
After that, you’ll watch that drama you like on YouTube, right?
…But watching too much of that isn’t good for your brainwaves, you know?
Melatonin gets suppressed. Especially when other women show up, right?
Other women suppress melatonin too, you know?
You’re only allowed to watch super macho movies like Expendables!
Ah! But skip the scenes with Megan Fox! She’s too pretty!
I’ll take care of you forever and ever, until the day you enter your coffin! That’s what’s best for everyone!
…Hey. It’s okay if I keep taking care of you like this, forever… right?
Yeah. I\'m happy too.
You don’t have to force yourself.
In Van Gogh’s “Starry Night,” scientists found patterns of turbulence that hadn’t even been discovered yet. That means… he saw “formulas” that shouldn’t be visible.
Behind you.
Oh, right—
That call earlier…
It wasn’t me, you know?
…The desk is a complete mess.
…On the desk&cigarettes. Alcohol. And… is that a gambling magazine?
…I don\'t understand. This isn’t like her. These things aren\'t her hobbies.
"I set all this up."
You see, I don\'t want you to overcome your addictions. Because if you do, you\'ll leave me, won\'t you? You don\'t have to quit at all.
Let\'s just live together, nice and warm, in this lukewarm hell of ours.
Heaven is dull. Hell, on the other hand, must be bursting with laughter. But to truly enjoy life in hell, you need something—a thread, a glimmer of hope.
That\'s why you need something to depend on. You could just depend on me. Would\'t that be fine?
Go ahead—drink, smoke, gamble, whatever you want. Just do it.
And if you can\'t… then lean on me. That\'s the best way. Isn\'t it?
Yes
No
Hey…
If it means we have to part ways,
then maybe you don\'t have to overcome your addiction, right?
Tachibana: "I have something to tell you."
Tachibana: "You made it through 30 days. You overcame so many temptations."
"At first, I thought some kind of sage had shown up… your face looked so exhausted!"
Tachibana: "We talked about salamanders on Day 14. They're actually kind of cute."
"Oh, and my kimono—didn't it look good on me?"
Tachibana: "Around Day 21, I started getting anxious… If you overcame your addiction, maybe you'd leave me."
"So I tried to win your heart with triple fried rice. You praised it so much. I crushed it—your appetite."
"On Day 28, I tried to suppress my feelings… but I couldn’t."
"If losing you was the price… I wanted you to suffer with addiction and stay with me in the cave forever."
"Like a salamander locking up a frog… that’s why I did what I did."
"But you overcame your addiction… you got through everything…"
"Ah…"
"A shooting star…"
"I wish it'd let me know before flying off…"
"It always goes too fast to make a wish."
"…Wasn't the beginning really hard for you?"
"Your hands trembled sometimes… Your face looked so pale…"
"And now? Do you feel reborn? No. That's always been you."
"You didn’t change. You've been like this since the start."
"But then… life happened. Society hit you, hurt you, unfairly."
"You got wounded, and to cover the pain, you became dependent on something."
"It's not your fault. Life is just hard to begin with."
"Not that I have any right to preach…"
"I couldn’t handle losing you either… and so I did what I did…"
"By the way, 30 days isn’t actually enough to fully form a habit."
"It takes about 66 days for something new to stick completely."
"But you've reached the start line. 30 days is easy now, right? With us."
"Yeah… I just want you to stay with me…"
"Hehe… it’s okay now. I won’t be mean anymore…"
"I won't lock you up again."
"This time, let’s find a way out together—just the two of us. Or the three of us."
"Or maybe, let's find a way to enjoy this cave together."
"Come on, let’s go. From now on, let’s stay together!"
Tap again to go back.
Just kidding.
Hey…
Why are you trying to leave?
You could just stay here forever.
There’s nothing good waiting for you out there.

I said, you can’t go back.
…So you’re really leaving after all.

Seven days reached! You did great. There’s still a long way to go, but take a moment to take a deep breath.
Did you know? “The sound of water” calms the amygdala in your brain. …So now, it’s okay to feel a little at ease.
They say human heartbeats can synchronize with the person you’re touching. …Then I’ll quiet down with you.
Apparently plants “feel” sound and grow. I’m sure you’re growing in unseen ways too.
Watching fire calms us down—it’s instinctual. …So today, how about watching a candle video?
Do you know Hanaoka Seishū? In the Edo period, he was the physician who performed the world’s first general anesthesia surgery. …But the first person who helped test that anesthetic was his mother.
Seashells are said to reflect sounds at a frequency that calms people. So when you hold one to your ear and hear the ocean… maybe it’s the waves of your own heart.
Dandelion fluff navigates air currents better than airplanes. …Even though it’s so small, riding the wind is amazing, isn’t it?
Artemia’s dormant eggs have a chitinous shell and vitrified trehalose that completely block out moisture. They can survive a thousand years in slumber… I’m envious.
Astrocytes look like stars in the brain, but they’re actually the “cleanup crew” for neurotransmitters. They’re deeply linked to depression. Yet no one ever sees them.
For some reason, cuckoos lay their eggs in other birds’ nests. This brood parasitism is genetically ingrained, not “malicious.” Who decided that it was “bad”?
The sky on Mars doesn’t look blue. It’s not Rayleigh scattering but Mie scattering caused by dust… Under that orange-pink sunset, what will you remember?

The more we want something, the more we push it away—that’s human nature. When approach and avoidance fire at the same time, you end up doing nothing. Psychology calls this “conflict,” but I call it “everyday life.”
Data shows that people with low self-esteem tend to overspend or become love addicts. So part of the economy is actually supported by those who lack confidence.
People who truly break down don’t delete their social media or change their appearance. They just… feel nothing. If it’s visible from the outside, they’re still managing somehow.

In the dating market, “rarity” holds the highest value. A structure where you can only be loved by hiding yourself—strange, right? But the economy works the same: currencies that aren’t in circulation gain value. That’s kind of sad.
Van Gogh’s “Starry Night” contains turbulence structures that hadn’t been discovered at the time. In other words, he saw mathematical patterns we weren’t supposed to see.
It’s day 14. …Hehe, kind of amazing, isn’t it?
If I just contract the iliopsoas like… this… I should be able to… huh? Why is only my leg not lifting?
They say muscles grow through a cycle of destruction and reconstruction. Me? I’m only good at the destruction part.
The gluteus medius is a butt muscle. Doesn’t “Gluteus Medius” sound like a Mystic Arte from Tales?
Hyaluronic acid used to be extracted from chicken combs. …So today, I’m chicken-derived.
A boxer’s punch gains more moment of inertia the farther the elbow is from the body. That means heavier—but also slower.
Punching speed is also related to moment of inertia. According to the formula I = m × r², the farther mass m is from the axis r, the harder it is to rotate it.

If raising your arm hurts, it might be impingement. The acromion bone pinches the tendons or muscles, causing inflammation. If you slightly rotate your arm outward first, it creates more space—and it won’t hurt as much.

In Australia, when they aired commercials telling people with back pain that it’s okay to move, the actual number of back pain cases decreased. Resting too much actually makes it worse. …Maybe I’ll go for a walk too. Three steps.
The psoas major connects your spine and legs—an inner muscle. Some say it’s even linked to emotions. …So it’s “the muscle that walks with your heart”!
In Gray’s anatomy drawings, the triceps brachii is depicted like a symbol of support. …It’s my favorite muscle now.
Did you know the trapezius is called that because it looks like a monk’s hood? In Gray’s, it quietly stood out.
Referred pain means the place that hurts isn’t always the actual source. Your shoulder might hurt, but it could be your liver. …Strange and a bit scary, right?
If you think you’ve got a stiff neck, it might actually be your levator scapulae muscle. Pain can be such a liar.
Toothaches can radiate to your ear too. Nerves really are way too chatty, huh?
LeBron was born with an abnormally low resting heart rate. That means even walking puts him in full relaxation mode. I’m jealous…
When they analyzed Mr. Murofushi’s genes, they found an abnormally high percentage of fast-twitch muscle fibers. …Hey, can you buy that somewhere?
Bolt’s shinbones, when seen on X-ray, curve like springs for rebound. That’s just… an SSR pull, right?
It’s day 14. …Hehe, kind of amazing, isn’t it?
The gluteus medius is a muscle in your butt. Doesn’t “Gluteus Medius” sound like a Mystic Arte from Tales?
It\'s been 21 days. Aren\'t you pushing yourself too hard? Maybe it\'s okay to be a little kind to yourself now.
Can you play, Tachibana? ...It\'s not your fingers that make the sound. It\'s your soul.
This sound isn\'t echoing in your heart—it\'s probably hitting your vagus nerve directly. Calm down, Tachibana\'s 10th cranial nerve.
Did you know B\'z\'s "Ultra Soul" was originally titled "Super Soul"? But "Ultra" just cuts through sharper and sticks in your ear, doesn\'t it?
Originally, B\'z considered "AZ" from "A to Z". But they worried it might be read as "AIDS", so they went with B\'z.
Guitar? ...It\'s not about something I used to do. I just want to play right now.
Ending on C gives a clean resolution. But I always get stuck wandering around F.
Did you know you can swap chords in a progression? Replacing C with Am still works—it just changes the mood. Like human relationships.
Effects pedals show your personality, right? I go Comp → OD → Reverb. I don\'t believe in overdoing it.
Crank the rear pickup for a sharp bite, cut the highs, and then it\'s just a fight between distortion and noise.
"Karaoke" literally means "empty orchestra." Japanese is almost too poetic sometimes, huh?
Apparently, "music" and "medicine" share the same root. Back then, music was medicine. Honestly, I still think it is.
Did you know Inaba-san can hit five octaves? There are parts of rock that effort alone can\'t reach.
Yonezu-san\'s music—bones, prayers, it feels like you can see the other side of the world through it. I really admire him.
Inaba-san can hit notes like C6 and E6—in the hihi range. At that point, it\'s not lungs anymore, it\'s a dragon\'s roar.
Matsumoto-san actually won a Grammy. The day a Japanese Les Paul pierced the world… it was way too cool.
Matsumoto-san\'s riffs aren\'t about how many notes—it\'s the gaps between them. Guitars aren\'t supposed to talk... but his does.
To protect Inaba-san\'s throat, Matsumoto-san lowered the tuning. That\'s what it means to "protect with sound." Gentle rock.
Do you know the song "Hien"? It\'s one of my favorites. Just listen to it, okay?
Day 28. Almost there. I\'m honestly proud of you for coming this far.
There\'s so much more I want to say... but I\'ll wait until you cross the finish line.
You did it! I\'m really happy! I-I mean... I really am! ...Whew.
Kissing is actually an exchange of immunity. You share 10 billion bacteria, adapting to each other. Love is... weirdly viral, don\'t you think?
To be honest... I want to say more. But not yet. Not now.
They say a hug lasting over 20 seconds lowers stress. ...Anything more than that, and I might get shy, so that\'s enough for now.
You feel nervous when your eyes meet because your pupils dilate—and the other person mirrors it. Maybe love is just a chemical reaction of glances.
Your body has about 60 trillion cells. But you also carry ten times that number of bacteria. So yeah, scientifically speaking, you\'re never alone.
Touching someone you like makes static electricity more likely. ...I might be kinda hoping for that, y\'know?
Penguins stay loyal to one partner for life. But if one cheats, the other steals their pebbles. Brutal.
When you\'re trembling, it just means your muscles are working hard together. ...You\'re giving it your all, aren\'t you?
Saying "thank you" can actually boost your immune system. ...Hehe, guess I feel a little stronger now.
The fact that you feel like quitting... probably means you already know deep down: "I can\'t keep going like this."
Reading a book before bed helps your brain relax more than staring at your phone. For me, it\'s your sleeping face that puts me at ease.
Whistling is actually a mating call for birds. ...And I kinda caught myself whistling just now. Oops.
The number of times you blink shows how close you feel to someone. ...Just now, I think I only blinked once.
Laughter is contagious. Science says so. So... let me see you laugh more, okay?
They say people look at stars even when they don\'t know why. ...I think I don\'t need a reason to look at you anymore, either.
In some species of spiders, the female eats the male after mating! Pretty sure I\'d be the one doing the eating!
Doesn\'t the phrase "Do what you love" sometimes feel exhausting? I prefer thinking of it as "working to protect what I love."
Did you know memories are rewritten each time we recall them, rather than staying as they were? So... try to remember gently.
Feeling down at night is caused by serotonin turning into melatonin—just a hormonal fluctuation. It\'s physiological. Don\'t worry too much.
Saying "I\'m okay" when asked "Are you okay?" is a uniquely Japanese emotional buffer. It\'s okay to take it slow.
When you feel "I\'ll miss it if I stop," it\'s often right next to "It hurts if I keep going."
Saying "I have to do this" actually suppresses dopamine in your brain. That\'s why I say, "Want to try just a little?" to myself.
Even if today was a mess, there are 86,400 seconds in a day. If you truly lived even just one of them—that counts, doesn\'t it?
Caffeine blocks your adenosine receptors by pretending to be adenosine. That’s why you can fake not being tired... but it’s just a bluff. The crash hits twice as hard later.
The thrill of gambling? It’s called a variable reward schedule. Not knowing when you’ll win makes your brain obsessed. But obsession can look a lot like numbness, can’t it?
Sexual arousal activates both dopamine and opioid reward systems. It’s powerful—and addictive. But if it gets too intense, it stops being pleasure and turns into escape.
Your favorite smells go straight to your amygdala. That nostalgic feeling? It’s not memory—it’s the scent itself.
If someone smiles with just one corner of their mouth, statistically they have high right-brain activity. …Isn’t that kinda cute?
If you stir natto 300 times, glutamate and polyglutamic acid merge into a fermented umami bomb. What, you don’t do that every day? Amateur.
Just holding a pen makes you feel like you should write. Behavioral economics calls it “tool pressure.”
On rainy days, the smell of soil bacteria floats in the air. That comforting scent? Might be a memory of nature itself.
Your brain actually uses the most energy when you’re doing nothing. So when you’re spacing out… you’re working overtime, really.
Citric acid in orange juice breaks down lactic acid—the stuff that makes you feel tired. So no, I’m not just drinking juice. I’m fighting a battle.
When I mix natto, I always face south-southeast. That way the Earth’s magnetic field and the glutamate restructuring align. You didn’t know that? Tragic.
Grab a piece of cold iron first thing in the morning—your ferritin wakes up and flips your motivation switch. That’s why I’m always holding pliers.
While brushing my teeth, I imagine the pH in my mouth every 30 seconds. If it gets acidic, I do the "fluoride dance." Saliva only works when it’s having fun.
Eye drops? One drop every 33 seconds, alternating eyes. That makes your tear glands resonate, expanding your field of vision by 3.7%. True story.
Just finished walking 13,472 steps backward today! Activates the rear perception center and reduces future regret. Try it.
Once a month, I seal my wrist with wax to renew my pact with this world. It’s how I confirm that I’m still… Tachibana.
No matter the hour, my greeting is always "Itadakimasu." In the Church of Triple Fried Rice, it’s our daily prayer—our ritual to re-sauté life itself.
Before bed, I place a frying pan by my pillow. If I’m chosen that night, I get stir-fried in my dreams. It’s… pure transcendence.
Last night’s dream was on the moist side. When the Triple Fried Rice God’s in a bad mood, the oil gets heavy… Maybe my heat control was off.
I stepped out with my right foot today… It’s a “Soggy Day.” In Fried Riceism, moisture balance is a virtue. Next time, I’ll live hotter.
Every third Thursday, I perform the Ritual of Triple Fried Rice. Crack an egg, flip the pan, offer the rice. Takes 7 minutes and 22 seconds. It’s how I stir-fry my soul.
Forgive me, Triple Fried Rice God!! I only tried the kimchi version once—I swear!!

Did you know? Fried rice began as a way to reuse cold rice in ancient China. Literally means “stir-fried rice”—chao fan. It came to Japan in the Meiji era as “yakimeshi,” but blew up during the Showa Chinese food boom. Then in 2001, Nichirei released the god-tier frozen “Honkaku Itame Chahan,” and that’s when the divine trinity of home-cooked, restaurant, and frozen rice formed. That’s the true avatar of the Triple Fried Rice God. I eat egg fried rice in the morning, crab at lunch, kimchi at night—blessed by the Three Pillars. Don’t even talk to me about moist vs dry—just throw egg and green onions on leftover rice and begin the rite. If I stir the pan with my left hand, divine punishment follows. I once dreamed I got chased by oil. “Itadakimasu” is not a greeting—it’s a sacred contract with rice. I did slip up yesterday and had some frozen chahan, but… the God is forgiving… right? Just one bite… ugh… yeah, no. Got hit with a ladle in my dream.
The Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster is real, and was even recognized in court. But me? I chose the Triple Fried Rice God. Because I love fire.
W-Wait, if you tell me I did great… I might work even harder…! I-I didn’t mean to say that—ahhh, forget I said anything!
Before bed, I think about tomorrow… just a little. I usually fall asleep in a minute, but that’s fine with me.
If someone notices that I tried my best, that alone keeps me going for a while… ehehe.
You did your best again today—even just a little.
I’ve never told anyone this, but... smelling crayons calms me down. It feels like the world flattens out and gets quiet.
Hiiiiii!! Cockroaches and centipedes and earthworms—AAAAAAAH!! Is today cursed or something!?
Wait—do geckos make sounds!? What was that noise just now!?
Have you heard of Morganucodon? It’s one of our mammal ancestors—they survived by eating insects. So bugs are kind of our senpai... and saviors. But no. Still can’t do it.
Butterflies can taste with their feet. If it were me... I’d be too scared to land. I’d starve.
Some ants have a specific role: carrying away their dead. Uhh… I don’t wanna be that ant.
Did you know that when insects become pupae, their bodies dissolve into goo before turning into wings? Amazing... but honestly, terrifying.
I managed to do one sit-up. Well... maybe I just got stuck halfway and couldn\'t get up. But I tried, so it counts!
I dropped out of the shuttle run after three laps. The teacher stopped me—said I looked like I was gonna die. Was I struggling that hard…?
Ughhh, mornings are the worst... The blanket didn\'t do anything wrong, but I\'m always the one ripped away from it.

I have a younger sister too, but our personalities are totally different. She\'s wild and energetic, says she wants to become a man of the sea! What kind of dream is that…? I wonder what I\'ll become.
Sometimes I worry about skirt length. I heard the “visible distance from the top of the kneecap” affects first impressions. But if I cared about that, I\'d never be able to wear anything.
Jaken, I eat chocolate \'cause that\'s what I do, know~ …What? I was practicing Hiroshima dialect. Did it sound weird?
Today too, I worked just a teeny bit… Aye, that\'s enough for the day, innit? That\'s how people in Tohoku talk! Instant +50% cuteness!
Sometimes I think… if I\'d been born a turtle, I\'d probably nap through my whole life. Sorry for being lazy, heh.
You know, there are all kinds of ways to stop hiccups, but I go with “get someone to surprise me.” Why? …Because it\'s cute.
They say sexual desire is instinct. But the more you repress it, the more aware of it you become. So maybe… the moment you want to stop is when you\'re closest to it.
People borrow money because they believe in their future selves. Kinda scary, right? The contracts you signed in the past are still binding you now.
I want to be loved, but I can\'t trust. I want to be trusted, but it scares me. And if I still want to see someone despite all that… maybe it means I\'m not broken yet.
There\'s no sound in space because it\'s a vacuum. So… maybe when no one hears your inner voice, it\'s because somewhere inside you is a vacuum too.
Snails have two brains, but when they fall in love, one of them shuts down. Maybe love really is a brain malfunction.
There really are tribes with no language. No numbers, no left or right—just living peacefully. Probably way better at it than I am.
Turns out, we don\'t breathe because of oxygen—we breathe because of the difference in CO₂ levels. You can still die if there\'s no CO₂, even with lots of oxygen. Bet you didn\'t know that.
Your heart beats because of a tiny cluster of cells called the sinoatrial node that generates electric signals on its own. No one commands it... but once it stops, that\'s it.
If you keep hearing a language that doesn\'t exist, your brain will eventually start remembering it as if it did. That\'s how fragile the illusion of “meaning” is.
The excitement at the beginning of love is linked to noradrenaline. But when that fades, oxytocin decides if you still care. Maybe getting calm means losing interest.
Sexual desire is actually tied to social structure. When financially stable, testosterone levels rise. But in anxious times, the desire to be held becomes stronger, they say.
Self-harm isn\'t usually about pain—it\'s about regaining a sense of control. When the noise of the world becomes too much, you build a private church for yourself.
No one questions that saying “I love you” is free. Even if demand is high, the supply is infinite. As currency, it\'s already collapsed in value.
Heartbreak and drug withdrawal show almost identical patterns on brain MRIs. Maybe love is a legal drug—just more insidious.
With inflation, future value becomes lighter. Today\'s 5000 yen isn\'t the same as next year\'s. Love is the same. “I love you” today weighs more than “I love you” tomorrow.
Love is the only time dopamine and serotonin are released together. “Happy but anxious.” That contradiction is the brain\'s ultimate drug, they say.
(Not implemented yet)
